sense.gloss: flow (of a fluid or gas), stream, current
flow (of people, things), passage (of time), tide, passing, (changing) trends, tendency
group of people who remain together after the end of an event
exchange (e.g. cultural), interchange, interaction, mingling, mixing, coming together
circulation (of air, water, etc.), ventilation, flow
floating (something on water), setting adrift, washing away
fashion, trend, vogue, craze, fad, popularity
to stream, to flow (liquid, time, etc.), to run (ink)
to be washed away, to be carried
to drift, to float (e.g. clouds), to wander, to stray
to sweep (e.g. rumour, fire), to spread, to circulate
to be heard (e.g. music), to be played
to pass, to elapse, to be transmitted
to be called off, to be forfeited
outflow, effluence, efflux, spillage, spill, discharge, haemorrhage, hemorrhage, bleeding (e.g. of ink into paper)
outflow (of people, capital, etc.), drain (of gold, talent, etc. from a country), leak (e.g. of personal information)
first-class, first-rate, top-flight, top-ranking, leading, eminent, top
one flag, one banner, one streamer
main course (of a river), main stream
to drain, to pour, to run, to let flow, to flush, to shed (blood, tears), to spill
to float (e.g. logs down a river), to set adrift
to wash away, to carry away, to sweep away
to broadcast, to play (e.g. music over a loudspeaker), to send (electricity through a wire)
to circulate (a rumour, information, etc.), to spread, to distribute
to cruise (of a taxi), to stroll around (in search of customers, an audience, etc.), to go from place to place
to cancel (a plan, meeting, etc.), to call off, to reject (e.g. a bill)
to do leisurely (e.g. running, swimming), to do with ease, to do effortlessly
to hit (the ball) to the opposite field
to do inattentively, to do without concentrating, to put little effort into doing
confluence (of rivers), merge (of traffic), conflux, junction, joining
union (e.g. of forces), linking up, merging, coming together
as one would expect, just as you'd expect (from), just like (someone)
still, all the same, after all
physical distribution, distribution of goods, logistics
upper stream, upper course, upper reaches
downstream, lower reaches of a river
drainage basin, catchment basin, river basin, watershed, valley
exile (second most severe of the five ritsuryō punishments)
banishment (to a somewhat distant province), middle-degree punishment of the three banishment punishments under the ritsuryō system

sdata.j: ↑飛行機↑↓ひこうき↓が↑乱気流↑↓らんきりゅう↓に↑近付↑↓ちかづ↓いていたため↑操縦↑↓そうじゅう↓↑士↑↓し↓は↑乗客↑↓じょうきゃく↓にシートベルトを↑締↑↓し↓めるよう↑呼↑↓よ↓びかけた。
sdata.e: As the plane was approaching turbulence, the pilot asked the passengers aboard the plane to fasten their seat belts.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓はそんな↑靴↑↓くつ↓が↑流行↑↓りゅうこう↓していると↑思↑↓おも↓っているかもしれないが、そうじゃないんだ。
sdata.e: You may think those shoes are in fashion, but they aren't.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓の↑英語↑↓えいご↓が↑流暢↑↓りゅうちょう↓なのでびっくりしています。
sdata.e: I'm amazed at your fluency in English.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓と↑同↑↓おな↓じくらい↑流暢↑↓りゅうちょう↓に↑英語↑↓えいご↓を↑話↑↓はな↓せればいいのに。
sdata.e: If only I could speak English as fluently as you!

sdata.j: ↑靴下↑↓くつした↓にも↑流行↑↓りゅうこう↓がある。
sdata.e: There are fashions for socks as well.

sdata.j: ↑近頃↑↓ちかごろ↓どんな↑曲↑↓きょく↓が↑流行↑↓はや↓ってますか。
sdata.e: What kind of songs are popular these days?

sdata.j: ↑橋↑↓はし↓は↑大水↑↓おおみず↓で↑流↑↓なが↓された。
sdata.e: The bridge was carried away by the flood.

sdata.j: その↑橋↑↓はし↓は↑洪水↑↓こうずい↓で↑流↑↓なが↓された。
sdata.e: The bridge was carried away by the flood.

sdata.j: その↑橋↑↓はし↓は↑洪水↑↓こうずい↓で↑押↑↓お↓し↑流↑↓なが↓されてしまった。
sdata.e: The bridge was carried away by the flood.

sdata.j: ↑橋↑↓はし↓は↑大水↑↓おおみず↓で↑洗↑↓あら↓い↑流↑↓なが↓された。
sdata.e: The bridge was washed away by the flood.

sdata.j: ↑橋↑↓はし↓は↑強↑↓つよ↓い↑流↑↓なが↓れに↑耐↑↓た↓えられず↑崩壊↑↓ほうかい↓した。
sdata.e: The bridge couldn't sustain the force of the strong current and collapsed.

sdata.j: ↑橋↑↓はし↓は１マイル↑上流↑↓じょうりゅう↓にある。
sdata.e: The bridge is one mile above.

sdata.j: ↑橋↑↓はし↓の↑上流↑↓じょうりゅう↓に↑滝↑↓たき↓がある。
sdata.e: There is a waterfall above the bridge.

sdata.j: ↑橋↑↓はし↓の↑上流↑↓じょうりゅう↓に↑私↑↓わたし↓はボートを↑見↑↓み↓た。
sdata.e: I saw a boat above the bridge.

sdata.j: ↑橋↑↓はし↓の↑下流↑↓かりゅう↓に↑小屋↑↓こや↓がある。
sdata.e: There is a hut below the bridge.

sdata.j: ↑橋↑↓はし↓のいくつかは↑損傷↑↓そんしょう↓を↑受↑↓う↓けるか、↑流↑↓なが↓されるかしている。
sdata.e: Several bridges have been damaged or swept away.

sdata.j: ↑去年↑↓きょねん↓↑流産↑↓りゅうざん↓しました。
sdata.e: I had a miscarriage last year.

sdata.j: ↑吸血鬼↑↓きゅうけつき↓↑伝説↑↓でんせつ↓はバルカン↑地方↑↓ちほう↓に↑流布↑↓るふ↓している。
sdata.e: Legends of vampires flourish in the Balkans.

sdata.j: ↑過去↑↓かこ↓のことは↑水↑↓みず↓に↑流↑↓なが↓せ。
sdata.e: Let bygones be bygones.

sdata.j: すんだことは↑水↑↓みず↓に↑流↑↓なが↓せ。
sdata.e: Let bygones be bygones.

sdata.j: ↑喜↑↓よろこ↓びの↑涙↑↓なみだ↓が↑彼↑↓かれ↓らのほおを↑流↑↓なが↓れた。
sdata.e: Tears of joy rained down their cheeks.

sdata.j: ↑岩↑↓いわ↓の↑間↑↓ま↓を↑小↑↓ちい↓さな↑小川↑↓おがわ↓が↑流↑↓なが↓れている。
sdata.e: A small stream ran down among the rocks.

sdata.j: ↑感動↑↓かんどう↓して↑涙↑↓なみだ↓を↑流↑↓なが↓した。
sdata.e: I was moved to tears.

sdata.j: ↑鴨川↑↓かもがわ↓は↑京都↑↓きょうと↓↑市↑↓し↓を↑貫流↑↓かんりゅう↓している。
sdata.e: The Kamo runs through Kyoto.

sdata.j: ↑外国↑↓がいこく↓↑人↑↓じん↓↑労働↑↓ろうどう↓↑者↑↓しゃ↓の↑流入↑↓りゅうにゅう↓が、この↑地域↑↓ちいき↓で↑深刻↑↓しんこく↓な↑住宅↑↓じゅうたく↓↑難↑↓なん↓を↑引↑↓ひ↓き↑起↑↓お↓こした。
sdata.e: The influx of foreign workers has caused a serious housing problem in this area.

sdata.j: ↑海流↑↓かいりゅう↓に↑変化↑↓へんか↓が↑起↑↓お↓きたのだろうか。
sdata.e: Has a change in ocean currents occurred?

sdata.j: ↑我々↑↓われわれ↓は↑流感↑↓りゅうかん↓の↑広↑↓ひろ↓がる↑速度↑↓そくど↓を↑鈍↑↓なま↓らすことができるだろうか。
sdata.e: Can we check the rapid spread of the 'flu?

sdata.j: ↑我々↑↓われわれ↓は↑流↑↓なが↓れに↑逆↑↓さか↓らって↑川↑↓かわ↓の↑上流↑↓じょうりゅう↓へとこいでいった。
sdata.e: We rowed up the river against the current.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓たちは↑時流↑↓じりゅう↓とともに↑進↑↓すす↓まなければならない。
sdata.e: We must keep up with the times.

sdata.j: ↑我々↑↓われわれ↓の↑船↑↓ふね↓は↑潮↑↓しお↓によって↑岸↑↓きし↓へ↑押↑↓お↓し↑流↑↓なが↓された。
sdata.e: Our boat drifted to shore on the tide.
